messages: 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:22): It has the problem of making the style sheet completely unpredictable
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:23): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: When you have style rules coming in from multiple sources, as we do in CSS, mode switches can really screw things up
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:23): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: because each author has a certain set of expectations of how things will behave
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:24): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: I see.

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:24): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: Consider that the UA style sheet wants to set indentation margins, the user style sheet wants to modify them, the sitewide style sheet is setting some sitewide tweaks, and the local section author is trying to design a page
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:24): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: if any one of them sets a global mode switch on an element to make things easier to specify on his end
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:24): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: it affects the rules by everyone else
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:25): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: and for something like directional-mode, that can really screw things up
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:26): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: One of the things that trips up CSS feature proposers the most is the cascade. They don't think about it.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:27): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: We've had many proposals in the CSSWG, often from WG members even, that trip up on the cascade...
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:27): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Hmm...how 'block-flow'?
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:27): how about
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:27): yeah, and box-shadow
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:27): er
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:27): box-sizing
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:28): I agree block-flow has this kind of problem. It's really impossible to represent a decent UA style sheet when an author can trigger a different writing mode.
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:28): I mean, it seems to me like 'block-flow' is very unpredictable as well.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:29): it is
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:30): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Do you actually prefer a solution beyond CSS for vertical text?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:30): what do you mean?
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:31): I don't know. Since you say you think 'block-flow' is unpredictable.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:32): it has a similar messing-with-expectations problem
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:32): I pointed this out years and years ago
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:32): but there's no really good solution afaict
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:33): ideally we'd have margin-start/end/etc
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:33): but that has its own cascading issues
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:34): My current suggestion is to modify @import to take a transform function
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:34): I am a bit surprised that *-start and *-end are not yet part of any stable spec yet, even though there's bidi issues.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:34): It's for two reasons
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:34): a) nobody's figured out a good cascading story
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:34): b) there's a lot of resistance from many members of the CSSWG to adding so many new properties
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:36): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Yeah. As r12a said, no company really wants to spend much time on internationalization.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:36): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: That's not the issue
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:37): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: it's not about developer time
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:37): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: it's about perceived need vs. perceived bloat
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:38): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: and, as I mentioned, the cascading problem
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:38): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: But at least *-start and *-end are already shipped.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:39): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: not really
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:39): without a good cascading theory I suppose?
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:40): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: like, Mozilla has implemented -start and -end
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:40): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: but only for the few properties it needs for the UA style sheet
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:40): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: not generally
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:41): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: and it deals with the cascade in a way that make the computed style output really confusing
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:42): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: Why do they need -start and -end for UA style sheet but not just some internal implementation trick?
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:43): (Sorry, this must be a dummy question)
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:43): I suppose they what people to use it, since it is documented.

3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:43): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: probably because in Mozilla, the easiest way to do an internal implementation trick that behaves like a CSS property is to implement it as a property?
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:45): 3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d: OK... By the way, what's your plan for Taiwan? I heard that you are going for the EPUB meeting.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:47): yes
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:48): my plan is to draft up CSS3 Writing Modes, at least the "implemenation" of its "api", given the "api" is still under discussion.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:49): and try to prevent epub and css from diverging too much
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:49): or rather, standard css and epub css from diverging too much....
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:50): If we're lucky, we find an api that everyone's happy with.
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:50): anyway, bedtime for me
3f21e54c5c5ffd50fe3680acc025bb1d (18:50): or rather, past bedtime :)
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (18:50): Oh, good night!
